Components Overview

Sirius UI provides a comprehensive set of React components organized into logical categories. Each component is designed to be accessible, customizable, and performant.

ðŸŽ¯ Component Categoriesâ€‹

Actionsâ€‹

Interactive elements that users can interact with to perform actions.

  • Button - Primary interactive element with multiple variants
  • Button Group - Group related buttons together

Feedbackâ€‹

Components that provide visual feedback to users about the state of the application.

  • Badge - Small status indicators and labels
  • Banner - Important messages and announcements
  • Spinner - Loading indicators
  • Toast - Temporary notification messages
  • Skeleton - Loading placeholders for content

Forms & Selectionsâ€‹

Components for collecting user input and making selections.

  • Button - Form submission and action buttons
  • Checkbox - Binary selection input
  • Choice List - Radio button and checkbox groups
  • Search Field - Text input for searching
  • Text Field - Single-line text input
  • Tabs - Content organization with tabbed interface

Layout & Structureâ€‹

Components for organizing and structuring the layout of your application.

  • Box - Basic container with spacing and styling
  • Stack - Vertical or horizontal layout with consistent spacing
  • Page - Full-page layout container
  • Layout - Application layout structure
  • Empty State - Display when there's no content
  • Media Card - Card layout for media content

Navigationâ€‹

Components for navigating between different parts of your application.

  • Navigation - Main navigation menu
  • Frame - Application frame with navigation

Overlaysâ€‹

Components that appear above the main content.

  • Modal - Dialog boxes and overlays
  • Popover - Contextual information panels
  • Tooltip - Hover information displays
  • Portal - Render content in different DOM locations

Typographyâ€‹

Text components for displaying content with consistent styling.

  • Text - Basic text display with variants
  • Heading - Section headings and titles
  • Title - Page and section titles
  • Subtitle - Supporting text below titles

Data Displayâ€‹

Components for displaying structured data and media.

  • Table - Data tables with sorting and pagination
  • Thumbnail - Image thumbnails and previews

ðŸŽ¨ Design Principlesâ€‹

All components follow these design principles:

Consistencyâ€‹

  • Unified design language across all components
  • Consistent spacing, typography, and color usage
  • Predictable behavior and interactions

Accessibilityâ€‹

  • WCAG 2.1 AA compliance
  • Proper ARIA attributes and roles
  • Keyboard navigation support
  • Screen reader compatibility

Customizationâ€‹

  • Extensive theming options
  • Flexible prop-based customization
  • CSS custom properties for styling
  • Tailwind CSS integration

Performanceâ€‹

  • Optimized bundle size
  • Lazy loading where appropriate
  • Efficient re-renders
  • Minimal dependencies

ðŸš€ Getting Started with Componentsâ€‹

Basic Usageâ€‹

import { Button, Text, Box } from '@adersolutions/sirius-react';

function MyComponent() {
  return (
    <Box padding="4">
      <Text variant="heading" size="large">
        Hello World
      </Text>
      <Button variant="primary">
        Click Me
      </Button>
    </Box>
  );
}

Component Propsâ€‹

Most components accept common props:

  • className - Additional CSS classes
  • style - Inline styles
  • id - Unique identifier
  • data-* - Custom data attributes

Variants and Sizesâ€‹

Many components support different variants and sizes:

// Button variants
<Button variant="primary">Primary</Button>
<Button variant="secondary">Secondary</Button>
<Button variant="outline">Outline</Button>

// Size variations
<Button size="small">Small</Button>
<Button size="medium">Medium</Button>
<Button size="large">Large</Button>

ðŸ”§ Customizationâ€‹

Themingâ€‹

Customize the appearance using CSS custom properties:

:root {
  --sirius-primary-color: #007bff;
  --sirius-border-radius: 8px;
  --sirius-spacing-unit: 8px;
}

Tailwind CSSâ€‹

Use Tailwind utilities to customize components:

<Button className="bg-blue-500 hover:bg-blue-600 text-white">
  Custom Button
</Button>

ðŸ“± Responsive Designâ€‹

All components are built with responsive design in mind:

  • Mobile-first approach
  • Flexible layouts that adapt to screen size
  • Touch-friendly interactions
  • Optimized for different device types

â™¿ Accessibility Featuresâ€‹

  • Semantic HTML: Proper use of HTML elements
  • ARIA Support: Comprehensive ARIA attribute support
  • Keyboard Navigation: Full keyboard accessibility
  • Focus Management: Proper focus handling and indicators
  • Screen Reader Support: Optimized for assistive technologies

ðŸ§ª Testingâ€‹

Components are thoroughly tested:

  • Unit tests for all functionality
  • Integration tests for component interactions
  • Accessibility testing with automated tools
  • Cross-browser compatibility testing
